meta.helperText: You don't even remember your name, do you?
This one is easy, just look in the mirror.
Morale measures your resistance against stressful & shameful situations, as well as your overall resolve & confidence.
Health measures your resistance against physical harm, as well as your overall well-being.
Experience points (XP) are a measure of your accomplishments and ongoing learning.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: Skills are aspects of your psyche with their own will and personality. They manifest themselves as voices in your head that react to what you do and what’s happening around you. They interject to provide help, argue with each other, and sometimes even make demands on you. There are 24 skills, and they’re non-player characters with full rights. Even more, they are the stars in your brain’s show, and sometimes you’ll just have to sit down and watch. The higher a skill gets, the higher its influence over you. Skills can be directly modified by putting points into them at character creation or spending experience points during the game. Internalizing Thoughts, wearing gear, and using drugs give bonuses and penalties to your skills.

meta.helperText: It believes everything’s a problem that can be solved, and that there’s one optimal way to do anything.
It has a memory as prodigious as selective and it can bless you with astonishing eidetic recollections.
The star of endless arguing and futile debate. The bread and butter of politicians and talk shows.
A euphemism for lying. But besides deceiving people, it also excels at performing.
It’s the spark of creativity that separates man from beast.
It loves reconstructing a crime scene and interpreting blood splatters and bullet ricochets like in a TV show.
It wants you to get shit done and become a better person. It makes you get up in the morning, quit drugs, eat quinoa.
An unstoppable stream of emotions and premonitions. It makes you experience the world through a lens of surrealism.
It helps you connect with the human condition and relate to the circumstances and suffering of others.
It's about respect, for both you and the institution you represent. It helps you be assertive and exert dominance.
It gives you flashes about your coworkers to better understand your tiny role in the institution.
Ah, the subtle art of making others think their interests and yours are aligned.
It prevents you from losing health when you’re hurt but encourages you to really try with its “bring it on!” attitude.
It keeps you functioning when you get hurt, ignoring your own blood spilling to the ground.
It makes you punch things right in their face. An adrenaline-junkie gym coach that encompasses all your physicality.
The perfect hedonist. It knows a lot about every drug on Earth, even the neurochemical details.
Feelings you can’t put your finger on. This guy wants to tell you something... if only you knew what it was.
It loves you so much it’s just afraid of anything that could hurt you, even your own ideas.
The one you need to throw a ball and catch it on the fly. To aim and fire a gun with a resemblance of competency.
The magnifying glass that gives you the details other people miss but in a cold way, detached from humanity.
It lets you dodge punches and come up with great comebacks at the speed of photons in a vacuum.
Balance, acrobatics, and stealth. It makes you effortlessly cool while jumping from roof to roof.
It covers all your finger-working needs. It also covers your motor memory.
It lets you keep a resemblance of calmness. It’s your stillness under pressure.

blocks.label: END OF A SCENE
blocks.value:
- RECAP YOUR NEW CLUES 
- TRY TO FORM NEW HUNCES 
- EARN XP 
- CREATE / INTERNALIZE THOUHTS

blocks.label: EARNING XP
blocks.value:
1 XP - FAILING A SKILL CHECK 
1-3 XP - EXPRESS YOUR CHARACTER  
2 XP - USE A NEGATIVE TAG IN A CHECK 
2 XP - FORM A HUNCH

blocks.label: CHARACTER CREATION
blocks.value: Assign the following points to different skills: 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2, and 1. Write these values in the natural column. Leave the remaining skills at 0. Choose 3 pieces of gear or drugs.

blocks.label: CHARACTER ADVANCEMENT
blocks.value: Spend 5 XP in order to internalise a Thought, or spend 3 XP in order to increase a skill by 1.
